edu.umich.auth.cosign.pool
Class CosignConnection

java.lang.Object
  edu.umich.auth.cosign.pool.CosignConnection
public class CosignConnection
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a Cosign Connection. It creates a socket connection to the cosign server, converts to an SSL connection and then starts a TLS handshake. It uses to check whether a cosign service cookie is valid or not. Once the check is over, it will return the connection to the connection pool.

Author:
htchan *

Method Detail

incrementCount

private int incrementCount()
This method increments the connections count of the connection pool this connection belongs to.

Returns:
the current number of connections in the connection pool

decrementCount

private int decrementCount()
This method decrements the connections count of connection pool this connection belongs to.

Returns:
the current number of connections in the connection pool

init

private void init()
           throws java.io.IOException
This method creates a socket to the cosign server, reads the banner, converts the non-SSL socket to an SSL one and starts an SSL handshake and then properly set the input and out streams.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If any socket/SSL exceptions occurs

getCosignConId

public java.lang.String getCosignConId()
This methods returns the cosign connection ID

Returns:
String The cosign connection ID

getUsageCount

public long getUsageCount()
This method returns the usage count of this connection

Returns:
The usage count of this connection

checkCookie

public java.lang.String checkCookie(java.lang.String serviceName,
                                    java.lang.String cookie)
This method checks the cosign service cookie against the cosign server. The cosign server will return a message in a specified format which will be handled in another class.

Parameters:
serviceName - The cosign service name e.g. cosign-wolverineaccess
cookie - The base64 cosign service cookie
Returns:
The response from the cosign server. Returns null if there is an IOException.

isSecureValid

public boolean isSecureValid()
This methods check whether the secure Cosign connection is still alive by issuing a NOOP request to the Cosign server.

Returns:
True if the socket/server is alive. False otherwise.

isValid

public boolean isValid()
This methods check whether the Cosign connection is still alive by issuing a NOOP request to the Cosign server. This method is only used for development/testing.

Returns:
True if the socket/server is alive. False otherwise.

setThePool

public void setThePool(CosignConnectionPool thePool)
This method sets the Cosign connection pool this Cosign connection belongs.

returnToPool

public void returnToPool()
This method returns this connection back to the connection pool it belongs.

close

public void close()
This method hard closes the Cosign connections.
